# description(withLocale:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a string representation of the decimal number appropriate for the specified locale.

## Declaration

```swift
func description(withLocale locale: Any?) -> String
```

## Parameters

- **locale**: Either an instance of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocale] or a dictionary with a string value corresponding to the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocale/Key/decimalSeparator] key.

## Discussion

This is a convenience method for calling the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDecimalString(_:_:)] function.

## Accessing the Value

- **decimalValue**: The decimal number’s value, expressed as an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Decimal] structure.
- **doubleValue**: The decimal number’s closest approximate `double` value.
- **objCType**: A C string containing the Objective-C type for the data contained in the decimal number object.
